subTitles: Where can I find my account owner?
body: You can find your account owner on your [Account Profile](https://zoom.us/account#) page of the Zoom web portal. [Learn more about the Account Profile page.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005731743-Account-Profile)

pageTitle: Frequently asked questions about local and cloud recording
subTitles: Why is the auto delete date for cloud recordings not being applied to some users?
body: If a user set their own [setting to auto delete cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005756143), it would will take effect, not the [group-level setting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819).

pageTitle: Frequently asked questions about caller ID
subTitles: How is the caller ID name determined on outbound calls from Zoom Phone?
body:
The caller ID name on outbound calls is determine by the Zoom Phone admin. If you're a Zoom Phone admin, you can [change the organization's caller ID name in the Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028553691#h_0200b39c-2011-41a3-bb09-1d1d7c41bf17). If have [multiple sites](/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672), admins can change the caller ID name for each site.

**Note**:


* The caller ID name is only applied to US and Canada phone numbers.
* Zoom Phone will attempt to apply the caller ID name to US/CA toll numbers. This is a "best effort" service with limitations. There are no technical criteria when the specified caller ID name will be applied to a toll number.
* The caller ID name applies to the entire organization or site. The admin cannot apply a different caller ID names for individual phone users.
* Phone users can [hide their caller ID name and number](#h_122140f0-5172-495d-b1cc-52ee8caea7fe).

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/zoom-voice/company-info/caller-id-name.png)

In the US, the caller ID name that is displayed to the receiving party is determined by the phone service that is receiving the call, not the phone service where the call is originating. The phone service that is receiving the call relies on a caller ID name database to match the incoming caller ID number with a caller ID name. In the US, only the caller ID number is passed along to the receiving phone service so it's up to them to match the number with a caller ID name.

Note that this may work differently depending on your country.

If you do not want your students to change their names, you can turn off the setting**Allow participants to rename themselves**at the [user, group, or account level](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005756143). If students are allowed to change their names and do change them, it will not reflect the new names in the attendance report.

Generally, VAT is collected by the business operator who supplies goods or services to its customers. The VAT is invoiced by the supplier along with the transaction price and collected from the customer. Subsequently, the supplier remits the collected VAT to the government.

subTitles: How will I know when someone donates to my OnZoom event?
body:
OnZoom Hosts who have created a fundraiser will be able to view a list of donations in the Host Dashboard.

If a fundraising goal has been set, the total donation amount raised to date will appear on the donation form visible to everyone if at least one donation has been made. If a fundraising goal has not been set, the total donation amount raised to date will appear if there has been at least $25 donated.

**Note**: Host's will receive an email to notify them when 80% of their event's fundraising goal has been met.

subTitles: Can I raise funds for anyone or am I limited to nonprofits?
body: Donations are currently limited to 2MM+ nonprofit and charitable organizations, including all US 501(c)(3) ‘public charities’ in good standing with the IRS, as well as qualified charitable organizations in 90 countries around the world. Pledgeling expects to roll out crowdfunding capabilities enabling donations to individuals in the coming months. Stay tuned!

pageTitle: Frequently asked questions about local and cloud recording
subTitles: How do I control the ability for admins to disable auto delete for users' cloud recordings?
body: Account owners can change the privilege to edit recordings using [role management](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646). If an account owner enables the privilege to edit recordings, the associated users can edit users' cloud recordings including the ability to disable the auto delete setting. There isn't a privilege for specifically disabling the auto delete setting.
Any external guests will not be able to join the meeting unless that specific party has an authorized account in your SSO Identity Provider.

subTitles: OnZoom Charitable Fundraisers: Donor Questions & Donations to Charitable Organizations
What nonprofit organizations can Pledgeling send donations to?
body:
Pledgeling can regrant donations to:


* Any US 501(c)(3) ‘public charity’ nonprofit in good standing with the IRS. Pledgeling's database has virtually all active US nonprofits in it (one exception is that nonprofits that were just recently approved by the IRS might not be listed yet).
* Hundreds of thousands of charitable organizations operating in 100 countries, including every charitable organization in Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, and New Zealand.

Have an organization in mind, but not sure if it qualifies? For US nonprofits, visit [guidestar.org](http://www.guidestar.org/Home.aspx) or [search the IRS site directly](https://apps.irs.gov/app/eos/).

If you'd like to request that Pledgeling adds an organization, please [see this page](https://help.pledgeling.org/en/support/solutions/articles/36000036072-i-want-to-donate-to-a-non-profit-but-it-s-not-listed-now-what-) for additional information.
